content.question: Let <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded by the graph of <math alttext="y equals x squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, the line <math alttext="x equals 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis. <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the base of a solid whose cross sections perpendicular to the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis are equilateral triangles. What is the volume of the solid?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction 16 over 3, end fraction, times the square root of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><msqrt><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 256 over 5, end fraction, times the square root of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>256</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><msqrt><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 1024 over 5, end fraction, times pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1024</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>Ï€</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 256 over 5, end fraction, times the square root of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>256</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><msqrt><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.8: Volumes with Cross Sections - Triangles and Semicircles

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
